posts.text: To read Shakespeareâ€™s poems and still think that what he says about time is just time and what he says about love is just love is to treat Shakespeare as a beat poet and the poems as meat from the supermarket freezer. Life is less than a line of metaphor in the literal sense of Shakespeare.
This infinite universe is all illusion to meï¼Œ and you are my roseï¼Œ my entire possession.

posts.text: Shakespeare expanded my understanding of poetry. Before thatï¼Œ all I knew was that poetry could be used to express love and affection. Now I know that it can also be used toâ€œUrge a friend to marryâ€. True. Everything can be a poem.
The themes of love poems have been turned over and over again by later generations of poetsï¼Œ but Shakespeareâ€™s poems are still shocking to read.

posts.text: Poetry is beautifulï¼Œ more beautiful than all his playsï¼Œ because the play is someone elseâ€™sï¼Œ the poem is his own.

The only thing that can be felt is the classical beauty that settles between the linesï¼Œ the truth against the liesï¼Œ the virtue against the hypocrisyï¼Œ the timelessness of love and poetry against the finiteness of time.
